title: Welcome to Re:Discover
tags: Developer Log, Web Development, Jekyll
content: As you can see, I've been revamping the site a *teeny* bit... Okay, maybe not teeny but at least I've havent switched themes again, but for a moment I did thought about it

title: Compartmentalizing my Digital Life
tags: Tech, Digital Wellbeing, Compartmentalizing, Habits, Hardware, Devices
content: I realized that if I want to stick to healthier habits, I should remove any barriers that prevent me from executing them. So I have divided certain tasks and activities between all of my devices, starting with...

title: Give Evening Pages a Try!
tags: Writing, Journaling, Freeform, Reflecting, Habits
content:
Writing can be hard and sometimes almost nigh impossible; it is something you have to be in the right mindset for.
For me, I don't have trouble staying motivated once I start; I can stay in the flow state for long periods of time. My problem more so comes from starting.

title: Has It Been Two Years Already?
tags: Web Development, Updates, Jekyll, Blogging, Writing, Milestones
content: Yes, apparently so! I'm still flabbergasted, but dates don't lie, do they? It has been two years since the start of this digital garden, formerly a blog, all the way back to my first post in March 2023. Wild!

title: Revamping my Backlog
tags: Tech, Backlog, Note-taking, Anime, Manga, Gaming, Tracking, Developer Log, Web Development
content: I've been quite happy with my backlog since I added it back in January, but now I'm closing in on the middle of the year. I like to rework it a little. The page itself won't change much, but in the spirit of transitioning to a digital garden, I'm adding dedicated pages to each entry in the log. Where I can have notes, summaries, and screenshots all in one place for media. Like a commonplace book but online.

title: Taking Inkdown for a Spin!
tags: Tech, Markdown, Note-taking, Visual Studio Code, Productivity, Writing, Tools, Software, Text Editors
content: I decided to go back to Markdown for all my notes. I use VS Code as my Markdown editor of choice for writing these posts and taking notes, but I recently learned about a new Markdown notetaking app that caught my interest, so I've decided to take it for a spin!

title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Is Making Me Feel Optimistic About This Series Again!
tags: Gaming, Pokémon, Thoughts, RPG, Follow-up, Impressions
content: Pokémon Day came and went and left us with a new trailer for the upcoming Pokémon Legends Z-A, and I have some thoughts on it.

title: What I Learned From Org-Mode and Why I Returned to Markdown.
tags: Tech, Org mode, Markdown, Todo.txt, Habits.txt, Plain-text, Productivity, Task Management, Tools, Git, Jekyll, Visual Studio Code, Command-line
content: I've been tinkering with Org-Mode for a while now; my search for more productivity tools led me to it, and I instantly fell in love with how it handles task management!

title: My Device Naming Scheme
tags: Tech, Mobile Suit Gundam, Hardware, Devices
content: I have always found it fascinating what others name their computers and devices. Just like finding funny and unique Wi-Fi names, it is a small window into someone's interests and personality. So allow me to share my own!

title: Finally Moved Over To Jekyll Chirpy!
tags: Tech, Jekyll, Web Development, Holidays
content: After much deliberation on my part and messing around with different themes, I finally decided to go with the Jekyll Chirpy theme!

title: Writing Challenge: Final Review and Results
tags: Writing, Challenge, Characters, Story, Original Works, Habits, Productivity, Worldbuilding, Brainstorming, Failures
content: Whelp, a week has passed but unfortunately due to unforeseen events with the weather, writing was far from being the most important thing in my mind these last couple of days...

title: Challenging Myself to Write More, Hopefully!
tags: Writing, Challenges, Characters, Story, Original Works, Habits, Productivity, Worldbuilding, Brainstorming
content: I've been having trouble writing fiction as of late. I have this original work that I have been mulling over for a while now and really like to get the first chapter out this year, but all I managed to write was some of the worldbuilding, CVs, and some notes.

title: Spice and Wolf: Merchant Meets the Wise Wolf is Fantastic so Far!
tags: Anime, Impressions, Fantasy, Story, Characters, Plot
content: I'm not much of a seasonal anime watcher, but this last season is an exception! With the return of the fantastic Spice and Wolf! And now that the first half has finished airing, I'd like to share my thoughts on it!

title: Transferring Files: The Better Way!
tags: Tech, Command-line, Linux, Windows, macOS, Android, File Sharing, Tools
content: Recently, I've been dealing with transferring large files, and while there are plenty of tools available to do the job, most of them are slow, have a size limit, or are cumbersome to set up. Luckily, I learned about a powerful and simple-to-use tool called croc while looking for alternatives, and it's exactly what I've been looking for in a file transfer tool!

title: My Journey in Computing Throughout the Years!
tags: Tech, Hardware, Software, Linux, Windows, ChromeOS, Nostalgia, Follow-up
content: I recently read a post by Kev Quirk about his computing history, and it seemed like a fun topic, so I'm going to put my own twist on it! I've been into computing for two decades now—yes, I'm old. (◔‿◔) In that time, I have gone through four computers; one laptop and three desktops, experimenting with several operating systems and applications!

title: My Habit Tracking System Using todo.txt!
tags: Tech, Habits, Plain-text, Todo.txt, Linux, Command-line, Scripts, Task Management
content: Todo.txt has everything you need for tracking tasks. But its syntax is quite expansive and easy to grasp. So, I made my own habit tracking system using its specifications and I call it Habits.txt.

title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A Looks Promising but I Can't Help Feeling Lukewarm About It
tags: Gaming, Pokémon, Thoughts, RPG
content: Back with another post, and this time about a game, if you can believe it! My recent posts don't really scream gamer, so let's change that! Let's talk about one of my favorite game series, or I guess you could say it used to be one of them.

title: Keeping My Notes Synced With Git and GitHub!
tags: Tech, Note-taking, Git, Markdown, Visual Studio Code, Command-line, ChromeOS, Android
content: Why don't I use Git and GitHub to sync my notes? After all, my blog repo houses .md files, the same files I use for my notes. Why don't I do the same? Now before we delve upon that let me tell you how I synced my notes and all my files before.

title: Why I’m Turning My Website Into a Digital Garden!
tags: Tech, Web Development, Jekyll
content: This time I want to share some plans I have for the future of my website and what that means for you!

title: Getting Started with Chromebrew!
tags: Tech, Holidays, ChromeOS
content: I am bringing you a short post for this month since I have been enjoying my holidays, and my last post was my longest and most worked on yet! So I'm taking a small break for now, but I don't want to leave you with nothing for this month, so here we are. I hope you enjoy it!

title: Why Fire Emblem Engage Is My Game of the Year!
tags: Gaming, Fire Emblem, Review, Thoughts, Community
content: This has been quite a year in the gaming sphere! is hard not to be overwhelm by the sheer volume of quality titles out this year and with every year us gamers decided on just one game to be our game of the year!

title: Learning The Arch Way!
tags: Tech, ChromeOS, Linux, Command-line
content: I'm not familiar with Arch at all, coming from Debian and Debian-based systems, so there is a fair bit to get used to!

title: Taking a Small Break
tags: Holidays, Burnout, Writing, Agenda
content: So hey! How have you been? I'm being good these couple of months, and luckily my health has not stagnated since I got sick mid-year.

title: Transitioning to Cloudflare Pages!
tags: Tech, Cloudflare Pages, GitHub, Jekyll, Web Development, Hosting, Git, Visual Studio Code
content: Well, hey there! It's been a while, hasn't it? I have been busy revamping this website and moving over to Cloudflare Pages, so before I go back to my regular posting, let me explain the process and what's new this time around!

title: A Fun and Easy Guide to Using Markdown on Discord!
tags: Tech, Guides, Markdown, Discord, Coding, Formatting
content: I frequent Discord quite often and I don't see many members using Markdown syntax to flair out their messages, which is a shame. So after some deliberation on my part and some fellow server members showing interest, I decided to write one! This guide 's goal is to hopefully be easier to understand and follow than the already existing Discord Markdown 101 support page. This is, however, my first time writing a guide, so please bear with me! But with that said, let's get to it!

title: Goodbye my First Homelab ; _ ;
tags: Tech, Homelab, Jellyfin, Linux, File Sharing, Hardware, Software
content: I was going to post about my neat home lab, but unfortunately, it didn't work out. I was hosting a SMB file share and Jellyfin media server on a ten-year-old Samsung laptop. I had it lying around, and I thought it would be a good way to give new life to old hardware.

title: Being Sick Among Other Things
tags: Thoughts, Agenda, Writing
content: I planned for this blog to be for long-form posts, but I guess I can make an exception for today, and microblogs and microblogging are pretty cool! But I digress.

tags: Anime, Pokémon, Impressions, Characters, Story, Plot
content: The new Pokémon anime series has dropped in Japan! and I have some mostly positive thoughts about it. Bear in mind that this post contains spoilers for the first three episodes. give our take.
